commentjust: "Most explanations B bring technically very specific justifications such as ""best sound mixing"". Explanations A bring elements better known to the general public such as actors, directors and awards. Explanations B can bring new information (or new relationships or even common curiosities) that arouse the curiosity of the public. People can also learn or get to know the product better through the justifications."
commentrec: "I think the reliability of the recommendation is related to the main elements known to the public. The recommendation is reliable when it presents relationships with elements most considered by the public. Perhaps a balance between popular, technical and market explanations can give more credibility to the recommendations.What builds trust? I think the recommendation should show its commitment to pleasing the consumer more than encouraging consumption for financial reasons."
